These studies highlight the differential mechanisms that regulate ERCC1-XPF activity in DNA repair

Collectively, these results demonstrate a new regulatory role for SLX4IP in maintaining an efficient SLX4-XPF-ERCC1 complex in interstrand crosslinks (ICLs) repair.

interpro.desc: DNA repair endonuclease XPF, nuclease domain

name: ERCC excision repair 4, endonuclease catalytic subunit
other_names: DNA repair protein complementing XP-F cells

excision-repair, complementing defective, in Chinese hamster

reactome.name: HDR through Homologous Recombination (HRR) or Single Strand Annealing (SSA)
Formation of Incision Complex in GG-NER

summary: The protein encoded by this gene forms a complex with ERCC1 and is involved in the 5' incision made during nucleotide excision repair. This complex is a structure specific DNA repair endonuclease that interacts with EME1. Defects in this gene are a cause of xeroderma pigmentosum complementation group F (XP-F), or xeroderma pigmentosum VI (XP6).[provided by RefSeq, Mar 2009].
